intro: Cardaminopsis maximowiczii, commonly known as the Siberian buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the cold climates of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
